Uplugging the ethernet won't prevent a ban, as the Xbox 360 has an internal flash that stores the security data from every disc inserted into the drive, if you do run a badly burnt disc you will be added to the banlist upon reconnecting to Xbox Live. MS doesn't do immediate bans (except on truly hacked boxes, not just DVD firmware), and adds pirates to a banlist that is occasionally cleaned out with a 'ban wave'. For the past two years there has been a ban wave in November, presumably to get pirates to purchase new boxes for Christmas. If you obtain a retail copy long before release (longer than three or so days, which could be a legitimate early street release), a trick is to unplug ethernet and the power cord for 10 minutes, resetting the internal clock to Nov 15, 2005, and only reconnect after official retail release. Presumably MS looking at players with unusual play dates will ignore a date so obviously incorrect.
